record.field: 1. Select the element that is not part of the critical thinking standards.
2. What is the definition of critical thinking?
A. Logically analyzing arguments in a critical way
C. Finding faults and weaknesses in other people’s arguments
D. Higher level thinking that aims to solve a problem
3. What is the worst thing for a critical thinker?
A. Reaching to conclusion too soon
4. Which of these can be considered thinking critically?
A. To think actively and being aware of potential problems in the information you encounter
5. What is the meaning of current information?
C. It is up to date

In this section, each exercise begins with a statement of facts that you are to regard as true. After each statement of facts you will find several possible inferences - that is, conclusions that some persons might draw from the stated facts. You are to examine each inference separately, and to make a decision as to its degree of truth or falsity.

field.name: description
field.h3: The degree of truth or falsity is rated on a 5-item scale, according to your apprehension:

ol.li: True - The inference is true and properly follows beyond a reasonable doubt from the statement of facts given.
Probably True - In the light of facts given, it is more likely that the inference is true than false.
Insufficient Data - The given facts do not provide sufficient information and a basis for judging to tell whether the inference is likely to be true or false.
Probably False - In light of the given facts, it is more likely that the inference is false than true.
False - The statement is definitely false. It is wrong, either because it misinterprets the facts given, or because it contradicts the facts or necessary inferences from those facts.

record.field: 6. United Bank is concerned about the increasing media coverage of suspicions of corruption among its top management staff. The VP of finance was accused of embezzling ten million dollars, for which the maximum penalty is eight years in prison. The bank's attorneys advised management to offer him a plea bargain according to which he will admit to the crime, return the money plus compensation, and serve one year of community service. The VP of finance is reluctant to accept, pleading his innocence.

field.name: description
field.h3: If the VP of finance is found guilty of the charge and the judge gives him the maximum sentence, the VP of finance can be sentenced to a jail term of eight years.

record.field: 7. A new study proves that scores on cognitive ability tests, which include critical thinking tests, are strongly related to success in both civilian and military jobs, and predict outcomes in all jobs. The added value of these tests, the authors conclude, is that they predict both what an individual can do right now, as well the extent to which an individual is likely to learn and develop.

field.name: description
field.h3: Nowadays, occupational psychologists use cognitive ability tests more often than in the past.

record.field: 8. Following a reduction in the number of applicants, the college has been asking students to evaluate faculty teaching performance for the last two years. The college's management announced that the purpose of these evaluations is to provide information to faculty about teachers' strengths and weaknesses, and to help higher management make decisions about pay raises and promotions to reward the better teachers. Last week, Professor Burke, a recently retired senior lecturer at the college, wrote a letter in which he objected to these evaluations, claiming they compromise academic standards.

field.name: description
field.h3: The college management does not care about academic excellence at all.

record.field: 9. Retailer groups opposed to Visa and MasterCard’s $7.25 billion settlement of a lawsuit over merchant credit card fees said they have garnered support from about 1,200 businesses covered by the deal. These groups urged U.S. District Judge in Brooklyn not to grant initial approval to the settlement, however, the ruling will probably be in its favour. That could end seven years of litigation over an alleged conspiracy by the card companies and banks to fix the fees that retailers are charged when customers pay with cards.

field.name: description
field.h3: The judge thinks that a conspiracy between the credit card companies has not occurred.

record.field: 10. Virtual employees, or employees who work from home via computer, are an increasing trend. In the US, the number of virtual employees has increased 39% in the last two years and 74% in the last five years. Employing virtual workers reduces costs and makes it possible to use talented workers no matter where they are located globally. Yet, running a workplace with virtual employees might entail miscommunication and less camaraderie, and can be more time-consuming than face-to-face interaction.

field.name: description
field.h3: Today, a majority of the employees in the US are virtual employees.

record.field: Choose whether the assumption has been made in the text below.
11. Wife to husband: Our joint income is lower than it could be. But soon I will begin to work at an additional part-time job, and I will earn extra income.

field.name: description
field.h3: The couple's expenses have increased significantly lately.

record.field: 12. 'A career at DX Electronics is the best choice—it is the most stable workplace.'

field.name: description
field.h3: Most of DX Electronics' employees are satisfied with their current company management.

record.field: 13. We forecast that completion of the development of supercomputers will be followed by a shortage of people who know how to make use of all this computing power

field.name: description
field.h3: It's only a matter of time until the development of supercomputers will be completed.

record.field: 14. About 330 marketing professionals attended this year’s Media Innovations Forum. This indicates that social media engagement is a substantial feature of brand marketing plans.

field.name: description
field.h3: The extent of attendance in professional media forums is not negligible.

record.field: 15. Ethics committee member: 'This person was the proctor at the exam during which the two students were caught allegedly cheating. Yet she claims to recognize the student who was giving the answers but not the student who was getting the answers. Therefore, the proctor's testimony should be excluded.

field.name: description
field.h3: If a proctor claims to recognize both parties involved in cheating, then the proctor's testimony should be included

record.field: A. Determining the cause of our beliefs
B. Pinpointing the psychological basis of our beliefs
C. Determining the quality of our beliefs
D. Assessing the practical impact of our beliefs
17. A belief is worth accepting if ______.
A. We have good reasons to accept it
B. It is consistent with our needs
C. It has not been proven wrong
D. It is accepted by our peers
18. The word critical in critical thinking refers to _______.
B. Attempts to win an argument
C. Using careful judgment or judicious evaluation
D. A lack of respect for other people
19. According to the text, critical thinking complements ____.
B. An affirmation of prior beliefs
C. An assertion that something is or is not the case
D. An assertion that is neither true nor false
21. Statements backed by good reasons are ____.
B. To be believed with certainty
22. The statements (reasons) given in support of another statement are called ____.
23. Statements given in support of another statement are called.
24. The statement that premises are intended to support is called.
25. The process of reasoning from a premise or premises to a conclusion based on those premises is known as.
26. Words that frequently accompany arguments and signal that a premise or conclusion is present is called.
27. A word that is not a premise indicator word is.
Choose whether the conclusion follows the text below.
28. Only technological companies are listed on OTX stock market. No technological company remains unstable for a long period of time

p.h3: If your company is listed on OTX, it will not be unstable for a long time.

record.field: 29. All Real Estate assets are either very large or located in central areas but not both. While no apartment is without air-conditioning, all air-conditioned RE assets are very large. RE Assets that are located in central areas are not apartments.

30. Bonds and stocks are both securities, which differ in that stockholders bought and own a share in the company, whereas bondholders lend money to company owners. Another difference is that bonds have a defined term, after which the bond is redeemed by the owners, whereas stocks may be outstanding indefinitely. I invested money in company C's stocks.
